alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 30 at 3:59AM CST until November 30 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Village Creek At At Avenue W affecting Jefferson County. .Heavy rainfall of 2 to 4 inches has occurred over the last 6 hours over the Village Creek basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Village Creek. Heavier rainfall has moved out of the area, and Village Creek will crest around 10.75 ft soon. Another statement will be issued by early this morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FOR EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Village Creek At At Avenue W. * WHEN...Through 5am. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Sections of the road in the digest area of the water treatment plant are flooded. Additional flooding in the digest area of the water treatment plant occurs and increases as the creek level rises. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM CST Wednesday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 2.2 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
